sections.title: Introduction
sections.body: MSSC is a government-backed small savings scheme, launched in April 2023 for women and girls. Available till March 31, 2025, MSSC promotes financial independence and savings for women by offering secure, attractive returns for a short tenure.[^1][^2][^3]

sections.title: How the Scheme Works
sections.body:
- Single-holder deposit (minimum ₹1,000, maximum ₹2 lakh per woman/girl; multiples of ₹100).
- Tenure: 2 years; interest rate **7.5% per annum**, compounded quarterly and paid on maturity.
- Partial withdrawal up to 40% allowed after 1 year; premature closure under specific conditions (death/critical illness).[^4][^5][^6]

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria
sections.body:
- All resident Indian women and girl children.
- Guardians can open accounts for minor girls.
- No upper age limit; only single-holder accounts permitted.[^6][^7][^8]

sections.title: How to Apply
sections.body:
- Open at post offices or authorized banks by submitting MSSC application, Aadhaar, PAN, address proof, and photo.
- Payment by cash or cheque.
- Certificate issued after verification; nomination facility available.[^5][^4]

sections.title: Important Points to Note
sections.body:
- Interest income is taxable.
- Multiple accounts possible with minimum 3-month gap, total deposit capped at ₹2 lakh.
- Safe, government-backed, short-term savings option with higher return than most FDs.[^2][^5]
